description: Analytics dashboard for reviewing reports from ParseDMARC

options.content:
# DMARC Alignment Guide
DMARC ensures that SPF and DKIM authentication mechanisms actually authenticate against the same domain that the end user sees displayed in their email clients.

This is acheived if **BOTH** these conditions are satisfied
* passing either DKIM **or** SPF, 
* the corresponding passing indicator is also in alignment; see below for alignment definitions

### Definitions:

**SPF Pass**  - The IP address of the email sender is authorized to send from the domain. SPF validates against the RFC5321.Envelope FROM.

**DKIM Pass** - At least 1 signature in the DKIM header is successfully validated. DKIM validates against the domain specified in the DKIM signature.

**SPF Alignment** - The email domain used for SPF validation (RFC5321.Envelope FROM) aligns with the domain in the message's from header that's displayed in the email client (RFC5322.Header FROM)

**DKIM Alignment** - At least 1 validated DKIM signature's designated email domain aligns with the domain in the message's from header that's displayed in the email client (RFC5322.Header FROM)

panels.description:
true - DMARC validation passed

false - DMARC validation failed
panels.title: DMARC Validation Results

panels.description:
Action taken by the reporting email server after performing DMARC validation and arriving at a result

none - No action taken to stop the email

quarantine - Email sent to quarantine (or junk)

reject - Email outright rejected by the receiving email relay
panels.title: DMARC Disposition

panels.description:
true - DMARC validation passed

false - DMARC validation failed
panels.title: DMARC Validation Results

panels.description:
Action taken by the reporting email server after performing DMARC validation and arriving at a result

none - No action taken to stop the email

quarantine - Email sent to quarantine (or junk)

reject - Email outright rejected by the receiving email relay
panels.title: DMARC Message Disposition

panels.description:
true - The HEADER FROM email domain displayed to client is in alignment with the ENVELOPE FROM used for the SPF check 

false - HEADER FROM and ENVELOPE FROM are not in alignment.
panels.title: SPF Alignment

panels.description:
true - The HEADER FROM email domain displayed to client is in alignment with the ENVELOPE FROM used for the SPF check 

false - HEADER FROM and ENVELOPE FROM are not in alignment.
panels.title: SPF Alignment

panels.description:
pass - SPF check passed

fail - SPF check failed

soft fail - for DMARC, should be treated the same as fail

none - No SPF record found

neutral - SPF record does not strictly forbid or allow

temperror - temporary error during SPF verification. Usually temporary

permerror - spf record likely is invalid
panels.title: SPF Authentication Results

panels.description:
true - The HEADER FROM email domain displayed to client is in alignment with the email domain used found in at least 1 DKIM signature

false - HEADER FROM not in alignment with any email domains found in any of the DKIM signatures.
panels.title: DKIM Alignment

panels.description:
true - The HEADER FROM email domain displayed to client is in alignment with the email domain used found in at least 1 DKIM signature

false - HEADER FROM not in alignment with any email domains found in any of the DKIM signatures.
panels.title: DKIM Alignment

panels.description:
pass - At least 1 DKIM signature was validated

fail - Message had DKIM signatures, but none passed DKIM checks

neutral - Message was signed, but the signature(s) contained errors or otherwise couldn't be processed

none - Message not DKIM signed

temperror - Could not be verified due to some error that is likely transient in nature

permerror - Could not be verified due to some error that is unrecoverable
panels.title: DKIM Authentication Results

panels.description: Header From is what's displayed in the email client, and is what a human reader sees when they read the email
panels.title: Count by Header From

panels.description:
Reverse IP address lookup of the sender IP.
Good indication of the sending service.
panels.title: Count by Reverse DNS Base (top 20)

title: DMARC Validation Analytics
